did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Includes sound mix elements, A and B roll cut negatives for Cornell films with collaboration of Urie Bronfenbrenner.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: Deborah C. Hoard (M.P.S. '78) is the president and producer for the company.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes sound mix elements, A and B roll cut negatives, camera reports, 16mm films and VHS tapes, for "Cornell II", "Cornell III" ("Creating the Future"), "Cornell IV", "Cornell V", "Family Matters" which was made in collaboration with Moncrieff Cochran and "Families in the Balance:Child Care in America" made in collaboration with Urie Bronfenbrenner.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: PhotoSynthesis Productions Cornell movie films, #6728. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Cornell V - (undergraduate recruitment film) - mix elements, negatives, 16 mm release, VHS tape and camera reports; also CHS tapes for Cornell III, "Creating the Future"
Cornell II - (for undergraduate admissions office) - mix elements, A and B roll cut negatives, 16mm release and camera reports

Cornell III - "Creating the Future" - (produced for the 125th anniversary of the university) - mix elements, A and B roll cut negatives, camera reports, 16 mm release and VHS tapes - 3 different versions were produced
Cornell IV - (update of the 1988 recruitment film) - mix elements, negatives, camera reports

"Families in the Balance: Child Care in America," done in collaboration with Urie Bronfenbrenner - mix elements, negatives, and two VHS versions - one 57 minute version for PBS and a 27 minute version to be used for training
"Family Matters" - done in collaboration with Mon Cochran - mix elements, A and B roll cut negatives, and VHS tapes
